data: PED SUS Buprenorphine Long Acting (SUBLOCADE)
Status
Ensure all Burprenorphine-naloxone (Suboxone) orders have been reviewed, dose adjusted, or discontinued prior to placing this PowerPlan

Buprenorphine is an opioid and providers should be familiar with College of Physicians and Surgeons of BC Practice Standards on Safe Prescribing of Opioids and Sedatives and BC Centre for Substance Use Guidelines on Treatment of Opioid Use Disorder

SUBLOCADE is only available through a restricted program called the SUBLOCADE Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategy (REMS) Program. Prescribers and pharmacies that order and dispense SUBLOCADE must be certified in this program and comply with the REMS requirement
Prescriber should apply for Special Authority through BC PharmaCare for coverage of subsequent doses
None
Patient Care
Communication Order
Monitor for signs of anaphylaxis and respiration depression for 15 minutes post SUBLOCADE injection
Apply Ice Pack
Apply to injection site for 10 minutes prior to SUBLOCADE injection. Reapply ice pack to injection site for 20 minutes after SUBLOCADE injection
Medications
acetaminophen
15 mg/kg, PO, once, drug form: tab
1000 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab
ibuprofen
10 mg/kg, PO, once, drug form: tab
600 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab
LORazepam
1 mg, sublingual, once, drug form: tab-sublingual
lidocaine 5% cream
1 application, topical, once, drug form: cream
buprenorphine long acting
300 mg, subcutaneous, once, drug form: syringe-inj
100 mg, subcutaneous, once, drug form: syringe-inj
